other_tests.procedure_name: Biopsy of the right superficial temporal artery
other_tests.findings: Narrow lumen with hyperplastic intima layer, focal disruption and fragmentation of the internal elastic lamina, marked thickening of the tunica media with multiple ill-formed granulomas composed of epithelioid cells, lymphocytes, and multinucleated giant cells. Multiple congested blood vessels, edema, and transmural inflammatory cell inflammation (lymphocytes, plasma cells, and neutrophils) were also seen.

other_tests.procedure_name: Color duplex ultrasonography of the temporal artery
other_tests.findings: Atherosclerotic vessel wall changes in both temporal arteries with perivascular hypoechoic halo noted around both superficial temporal arteries, more prominent on the right than the left.

other_tests.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain, brain stem and neck
other_tests.findings: Failed to reveal any characteristic features.

other_tests.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance angiography (MRA) of the neck vessels and circle of Willis
other_tests.findings: Showed no narrowing, aneurysm, malformations, dissections, or other significant abnormalities.
